question: Match the following:
matches: Kingdom Plantae – Includes all eukaryotic chlorophyll-containing organisms
Bladderwort and Venus fly trap – Examples of insectivorous plants
Cuscuta – Parasite
Plant cell wall – Mainly made of cellulose
answer: Kingdom Plantae – Includes all eukaryotic chlorophyll-containing organisms, Bladderwort and Venus fly trap – Examples of insectivorous plants, Cuscuta – Parasite, Plant cell wall – Mainly made of cellulose

question: Match the following:
columnA: Two distinct phases in plant life cycle
columnB: Algae, bryophytes, pteridophytes, gymnosperms and angiosperms
Alternation of haploid and diploid phases
matches: Prominent organelle in plant cell – Chloroplasts
Groups included in Plantae – Algae, bryophytes, pteridophytes, gymnosperms and angiosperms
Two distinct phases in plant life cycle – Diploid sporophytic and haploid gametophytic
Alternation of generations – Alternation of haploid and diploid phases
answer: Prominent organelle in plant cell – Chloroplasts, Groups included in Plantae – Algae, bryophytes, pteridophytes, gymnosperms and angiosperms, Two distinct phases in plant life cycle – Diploid sporophytic and haploid gametophytic, Alternation of generations – Alternation of haploid and diploid phases

question: Match the following:
columnB: Heterotrophic eukaryotic organisms that are multicellular
matches: Kingdom Animalia – Heterotrophic eukaryotic organisms that are multicellular
Nutrition in animals – Holozoic – by ingestion of food
Food reserves in animals – Stored as glycogen or fat
Cells of animals – Lack cell walls
answer: Kingdom Animalia – Heterotrophic eukaryotic organisms that are multicellular, Nutrition in animals – Holozoic – by ingestion of food, Food reserves in animals – Stored as glycogen or fat, Cells of animals – Lack cell walls

question: Match the following:
columnB: Definite growth pattern into adults with definite shape and size
By copulation of male and female
matches: Growth in animals – Definite growth pattern into adults with definite shape and size
Higher forms of animals – Elaborate sensory and neuromotor mechanism
Sexual reproduction in animals – By copulation of male and female
Embryological development – Follows sexual reproduction
answer: Growth in animals – Definite growth pattern into adults with definite shape and size, Higher forms of animals – Elaborate sensory and neuromotor mechanism, Sexual reproduction in animals – By copulation of male and female, Embryological development – Follows sexual reproduction

question: Match the following:
columnA: Reason viruses not placed in classification
columnB: Not mentioned in Whittaker’s five kingdom classification
Not considered truly living since they lack cell structure
matches: Lichens – Not mentioned in Whittaker’s five kingdom classification
Viruses – Non-cellular organisms
Outside the living cell – Inert crystalline structure
Reason viruses not placed in classification – Not considered truly living since they lack cell structure
answer: Lichens – Not mentioned in Whittaker’s five kingdom classification, Viruses – Non-cellular organisms, Outside the living cell – Inert crystalline structure, Reason viruses not placed in classification – Not considered truly living since they lack cell structure
